job_title: Faculty Member in New York, NY
pros: Nice campus, friendly staff, beautiful library
cons: Program doesn’t want to change with times

review_title: Terrible place to work -  Do not waste any part of your life here
pros: The time off work is more then anyone ever needs
cons: The culture is at best combative - little room for voices that differ from management - A workplace devoid of opportunities - Administrators will self congratulate each other, while working to undermine employees.

pros: NYS pension with excellent benefits and PTO
cons: Low salaries for administrators and very little room for promotion or advancement unless politically connected.

job_title: Professor In Health, Science, Math in Sanborn, NY
pros: Dedicated faculty who care for their students.
cons: Inexperienced administration. Lacks ability to create an effective strategic plan.

review_title: A Cesspool of Negativity and Fear
pros:
Some of the students are amazing and invested.
Some of the faculty are truly good people that are enjoyable to know.
Benefits are good.
The library staff are knowledgeable and helpful.
cons:
The President governs by fear, which has caused negative workplace climate.  
There is rapid turnover in the administration at key positions.  There have been 3 different Academic VPs in the past 3 years. 
Many have worked there for 20 or more years, which creates a certain rigidity and cantankerousness. There was a promotion and raise freeze for 9 years, which caused a huge, bitter rift between the administration and the faculty.

pros: Work/life balance is ok.  Many talented, excellent educators and administrators and support staff.
cons: Unless you are a full time faculty member, you won't be treated well.  Leadership from the very top is non-existent.  Every dept is a silo, trying to outshine the others.  The culture is poison.  Don't waste your time.

pros: There are no pros to working at this college. It was the worst experience I ever had in my academic career.
cons:
Extremely low morale due to administration's refusal to settle contract for 8 years. Faculty voted no confidence, yet board renews president.

Non tenured jobs last no longer than 2 years, sometimes only 1 year -- don't relocate to work here.

Full-time faculty teaching load = 18 hrs/week, unbelievable!

Very little remedial support for unprepared students.

No respect for faculty's academic achievements. You are easily replaced.

pros: Was great before COVID. Work alone, nice housrs, sick pay, flexible.
cons: COVID hit. My hours took a huge hit. Couldn't continue financially. Looking for other work.

job_title: Residence Life Programming Coordinator in Houston, TX
pros: No micro managing, very flexible with hours and understanding.
cons: Low pay, no direction in what they are looking for and no benefits

pros: The only pro is that it fits into scheduling.
cons: Lack of concern for employees overall.
